citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
While reviewing the Spring and Fall 2022 Semi-Annual Reports to the Institutional Official (IO), it was discovered that the
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) failed to review their program for humane care and use of animals
within a 6-month period. The spring 2022 program review was performed on May 31, 2022, but the next program review
was not conducted until January 3, 2023. Failure to review the program for humane care and use of animals at the
interval indicated within the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) could negatively impact the animals covered under the program by
misidentifying program discrepancies, and therefore effect their welfare. With respect to activities involving animals, the
IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, must review, at least once every six months, the research facility’s program
for humane care and use of animals, using title 9, chapter I, subchapter A – Animal Welfare, as a basis for evaluation.
The subsequent spring 2023 Semi-Annual program review was conducted at the required interval.
Correct by: July 31, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
